result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric G Kaster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric G Kaster

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per agent Michael Peterson, defendant has been REVOKED, review date cancelled.

Defendant Eric G Kaster in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to both counts:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.
AS to count 1:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 8 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 8 days time served.  Court orders all costs, assessments and surcharges, DOMESTIC ABUSE s/c, DNA s/c to be paid during probation in count 2 and non-payment will result in civil judgment.
AS to count 2:   The court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 60 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge AS TO COUNT 1, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Pay all costs, assessments and surcharges as to count 1.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Eric G Kaster not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
For reasons stated on the record, court orders bench warrant withdrawn and bail reinstated.  Defense counsel requests a plea/sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Status Report dated July 30, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program report dated July 1, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called at 10:52 am.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.  mld

Defendant Eric G Kaster in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Modify The No Contact Order to No Violent Contact is heard and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-26-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

15RM024857  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/16/2015

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Samantha L or her minor children

Defendant Eric G Kaster in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Eric G Kaster in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
